message_1: A mathematician needs to categorize a set of 50 integers into two types (Type A and Type B). If the set contains 20 Type A integers, what is the maximum number of Type B integers that could be in the set?
message_2:
If there are 20 Type A integers in the set, then the remaining integers would be Type B. Since there are 50 integers in total, the maximum number of Type B integers would be:

50 - 20 = 30

So, there could be a maximum of 30 Type B integers in the set.
